page.title: 13SHOPPING & TRAVELLING
page.content:
During July 1985, a number of people at Carclaze were asked about their shopping and travelling habits.
Most people said they did their main shoping in St. Austell, buying their week's provisions in one trip. They used the local shops in Carclaze if they ran out of small items and went to Plymouth for major items, such as suits, new dresses and Christmas presents.
Although over half the people surveyed travelled to work by car, many used the public transport system regularly. Several said that the local mini-bus service was good and would like to see it extended. Many people used the train service from St.Austell for long journeys.
